description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Output 6.8 Survive and thrive. LAC COs have increased capacity to develop, implement, monitor, advocate and deliver results for every child to survive and thrives, including in emergencies, fragile and humanitarian contexts.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: Ending violence against children remains a flagship priority for UNICEF in LAC under the leadership of the EVAC regional Task Force. The COVID pandemic continued to affect VAC in the region, with the lockdowns restricting access to response services. The EVAC theory of change was revised and adjusted and the EVAC strategy for the region developed in consultation with all COs. Intersectoral work at regional level with ADAP, ECD, PFP, Comms and others to end VaC has continued and has been strengthened. | Status:Met | As-of Date:28/02/2022
